intro: Bilabrella salsicornis, commonly known as sea fennel, is a halophytic plant that thrives in saline environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant has slender, hairless stems and is characterized by its small, white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and often have a distinctive, slightly aromatic scent. It is often found in coastal areas and salt marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
